channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A.I. Chatbot for Los Angeles Schools Falls Flat
item.description: Los Angeles schools hired a start-up to build an A.I. chatbot for parents and students. A few months later, the company collapsed.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Gaza’s Aid Woes Pile Up
item.description: The departure of the United Nations’ top relief official added uncertainty to the struggling efforts to get food, fuel and other supplies into the territory.

item.title: Gen Zers are so disillusioned with the economy that they think it’s OK to commit fraud
item.description: A third of Gen Zers either know someone who has participated in payment fraud or have done so themselves.

item.title: Hurricane Beryl Threatens the Caribbean as a Category 3 Storm
item.description: The tropical cyclone was expected to bring “potentially catastrophic” wind damage as it moves through the Windward Islands.

item.title: Ismail Kadare Dies at 88; Novels Brought Albania’s Plight to the World
item.description: He was compared to Orwell and Kafka, and walked a political tightrope with works of veiled criticism for his totalitarian state.

item.title: Credit card gun sales are the new policy flight after California requires Visa and Mastercard to provide special codes for gun store buys, while Georgia and others ban the practice
item.description: Over the past 16 months, 17 states with GOP-led legislatures have passed measures prohibiting a firearms store code or limiting its use.

item.title: The Week After the Debate
item.description: Where does President Biden’s campaign go from here?

item.title: France Reacts to Big Far-Right Wins in First Round of Snap Election
item.description: Many expressed shock that Marine Le Pen’s nationalist party was so close to power after the first round of a snap election.

item.title: Biden’s family tells him to remain in race despite dreadful debate performance, and some are now criticizing how staff prepared him
item.description: While the president was huddled with his family, prominent Democrats rallied to deliver a public show of support for his campaign on Sunday.

item.title: Ismail Kadare Dies at 88; Novels Brought Albania’s Plight to the World
item.description: He was compared to Orwell and Kafka, and walked a political tightrope with works of veiled criticism for his totalitarian state.

item.title: A Culture War Erupted Over U.K. Stately Homes. Who Won?
item.description: A battle over the history of Britain’s prized country houses offers a window into the national mood before a pivotal election.

item.title: LVMH billionaire Bernard Arnault enters race to acquire Venice’s iconic Hotel Bauer—with bids rising over €275 million
item.description: The Hotel Bauer was one of the crown jewels of the Austrian mogul Rene Benko's real estate empire.

item.title: France Reacts to Big Far-Right Wins in First Round of Snap Election
item.description: Many expressed shock that Marine Le Pen’s nationalist party was so close to power after the first round of a snap election.

item.title: The Rubik Cube Turns 50
item.description: Mathematicians and hobbyists have had a half-century of fun exploring the some 43 billion billion permutations of Erno Rubik’s creation.

item.title: French market rebounds and euro edges up after France’s far-right National Rally clinches first-round vote
item.description: Shares of France's Societe Generale, BNP Paribas and Credit Agricole all jumped post election results.
